rationale: Team A capitalizes on its significant RB depth by trading a top asset in Saquon Barkley to acquire a legitimate WR1 in Drake London, which is Team A's biggest roster need. For Team B, this trade allows them to consolidate their immense QB surplus by trading C.J. Stroud—an asset they cannot start—to acquire a true workhorse RB in Barkley, directly addressing their weakest position group.
